TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE he lodged a claim with ORG of PERSON ( “ the ORG ” ) against ORG seeking damages for injuries caused to him by its employee Mr O.
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE and from DATE to CARDINAL DATE the proceedings were suspended pending the outcome of criminal proceedings against Mr O.
CARDINAL . Following CARDINAL remittals of the case for fresh examination , on DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant ’s claim and awarded him certain amounts in damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively the ORG of Appeal and ORG ( the latter court acting as a court of cassation ) upheld the above judgment . The decision of DATE was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , in the course of the proceedings the applicant CARDINAL times amended his claim . The courts adjourned QUANTITY hearings following the applicant ’s requests or due to his and other parties’ failure to attend them . The applicant disagreed stating that he had not been informed of the hearings which he had not attended . CARDINAL hearings were further adjourned following other parties’ requests , their failure to appear or for unspecified reasons .
